titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that Senate Joint Resolution 23 (107th Congress), as adopted by the Senate on September 14, 2001, and subsequently enacted as the Authorization for Use of Military Force does not authorize warrantless domestic surveillance of United States citizens.

A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that Senate Joint Resolution 23 (107th Congress), as adopted by the Senate on September 14, 2001, and subsequently enacted as the Authorization for Use of Military Force does not authorize warrantless domestic surveillance of United States citizens.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: Expresses the sense of the Senate that the Authorization for Use of Military Force (P.L. 107-40, enacted September 18, 2001) does not authorize warrantless domestic surveillance of United States citizens.
